body:
Can you share what version of Helm you are using? Helm v2 uses Sprig v2 which goes not have the htpasswd function. Helm v3 uses Sprig v3 which does include that function.

Speaking as a Sprig maintainer, I would be willing to merge a backport of that function to Sprig v2 if someone wants to work on it.

So, I made a simple chart with a single template:
```
{{ htpasswd "example" "password" }}
```
```
% helm-2.16.1 template .
Error: parse error in "test/templates/NOTES.txt": template: test/templates/NOTES.txt:1: function "htpasswd" not defined
% helm-3.0.3 template . 
Error: parse error at (test/templates/NOTES.txt:1): function "htpasswd" not defined
```
I'd love to have `htpasswd` backported to v2, but it is probably worth pointing out that `htpasswd` doesn't appear to be available in helm v3 either

It looks like https://github.com/Masterminds/sprig/pull/225 was merged only 2 weeks ago, so it's not yet in a sprig release.

Helm 3.0.3 currently relies on Sprig 3.0.2.

https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/v3.0.3/go.mod#L9

Once a new release of sprig is available, we can bump Helm to the latest version aand `htpasswd` should become available.
i think this would be better labelled as a feature request, rather than question/support
Oh, @technosophos merged that. Let's see about bringing this into Helm 3.2.0. I can make that happen.
Friendly reminder that 3.2 is right around the bend.

issue.title: Updating sprig and semver to newer versions

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: v3.x
labels.description: Issues and Pull Requests related to the major version v3

milestone.description: This is the next stable feature release of Helm 3. Non-breaking feature additions are allowed, as are bug fixes.

issue.body:
Note, there is an issue with a dependency of sprig changing
behavior. A test has been added with a description to catch if a
behavior breaking change of mergo is used.

See https://github.com/imdario/mergo/issues/139 for the mergo
issue and sprig for further details on handling this in the
future.

Closes  #7533

body:
Hello everyone,

Can someone help me, pls?

i got a ingress with basic auth on my K8S:
here is the yaml:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Secret
type: Opaque
metadata:
  name: basic-auth
  namespace: t
data:
  auth: >-
     {{ .Values.basicAuth.authString | b64enc }}


----
value.yaml

basicAuth:
 authString: |
   htpwd1:b7NRGSot585DjHtXjlqusep
   htpwd2:fpzefczfzz585DjHtXjlquver

But I want to do that with helm: like

apiVersion: v1
kind: Secret
type: Opaque
metadata:
  name: basic-auth
  namespace: t
data:
  auth: >-
     {{ htpasswd .Values.basicAuth.auth1.username .Values.basicAuth.auth1.password  | b64enc | quote }} 
     {{ htpasswd .Values.basicAuth.auth2.username .Values.basicAuth.auth2.password  | b64enc | quote }} 

----
value.yaml

basicAuth:
 auth1: 
   username
   password
 auth2: 
   username
   password

Can someone help, please?

Hello @bonpapajosie 

For use the multi user/password you can use this sample.

On your ingress annotation:
```yaml
    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/auth-type: "basic"
    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/auth-secret: "htpasswd-secret"
    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/auth-secret-type: "auth-map"
    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/auth-realm: "Authentication required!"
``` 

For the secret:
```yaml
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: Secret
metadata:
  name: "htpasswd-secret"
type: Opaque
data:
  {{- range $user, $password := .Values.ingress.users }}
  {{ $user }}: {{ htpasswd $user $password | trimPrefix (print $user ":") | b64enc }}
  {{- end }}
```

And for your values:
```yaml
ingress:
  users:
    user1: password1
    user2: password2
    ...: ...
```
